info.official_title: A Multicenter, Phase II, Open Label, Randomized Trial Evaluating the Efficacy of Tedopi Plus Docetaxel or Tedopi Plus Nivolumab as Second-line Therapy in Metastatic Non-small-cell Lung Cancer Progressing After First-line Chemo-immunotherapy (Combi-TED)

inclusion_lines.line: 1. Male and female patients willing and able to give written informed consent;

criterions.exact_snippets: Male and female patients
willing and able to give written informed consent

inclusion_lines.line: 2. Histological or cytological confirmed diagnosis of HLA-A2+ NSCLC with no evidence of EGFR mutations or ALK or ROS1 rearrangement;

criterions.exact_snippets: Histological or cytological confirmed diagnosis
HLA-A2+ NSCLC
HLA-A2+ NSCLC
no evidence of EGFR mutations
no evidence of ... ALK ... rearrangement
no evidence of ... ROS1 rearrangement

inclusion_lines.line: 3. Evidence of disease progression at the end of at least 4 cycles of chemo-immunotherapy or 2 cycles of chemo-immunotherapy followed by 2 cycles of immunotherapy (CheckMate9LA regimen) and eligible for treatment with docetaxel. This criterion implies that patients with immunotherapy primary resistance are excluded;

criterions.exact_snippets: Evidence of disease progression
at the end of at least 4 cycles of chemo-immunotherapy
2 cycles of chemo-immunotherapy followed by 2 cycles of immunotherapy (CheckMate9LA regimen)
eligible for treatment with docetaxel
patients with immunotherapy primary resistance are excluded
Performance status 0-1 (ECOG)
Patient compliance to trial procedures
Age ≥ 18 years
Adequate BM function (ANC ≥ 1.5x109/L
Adequate BM function ... Platelets ≥ 100x109/L
Adequate BM function ... HgB > 9g/dl

inclusion_lines.line: 9. Adequate liver function (bilirubin < G2, transaminases no more than 3xULN/<5xULN in present of liver metastases);

criterions.exact_snippets: Adequate liver function (bilirubin < G2
transaminases no more than 3xULN/<5xULN in present of liver metastases
Normal level of creatinine

inclusion_lines.line: 11. Female patient: childbearing potential either terminated by surgery, radiation, or menopause, or attenuated by use of approved contraceptive method [complete abstinence, intrauterine contraceptive device (IUD), birth control pills, or barrier device] until 5 months after end of treatment.

criterions.exact_snippets: Female patient
childbearing potential either terminated by surgery, radiation, or menopause
attenuated by use of approved contraceptive method [complete abstinence, intrauterine contraceptive device (IUD), birth control pills, or barrier device]
until 5 months after end of treatment

inclusion_lines.line: or Male patient: should practice complete abstinence or if sexually active with WOCBP must use any contraceptive method with failure rate less than 1%/year and they should not donate semen as follows: in arm A and C until 6 months since the last dose of docetaxel; in arm B until 3 months since last dose of tedopi.

criterions.exact_snippets: Male patient
should practice complete abstinence
if sexually active with WOCBP must use any contraceptive method with failure rate less than 1%/year
they should not donate semen
in arm A and C until 6 months since the last dose of docetaxel
criterions.criterion: semen donation restriction duration for arm A and C

criterions.exact_snippets: in arm B until 3 months since last dose of tedopi
criterions.criterion: semen donation restriction duration for arm B

inclusion_lines.line: 12. Prior palliative radiotherapy to non-CNS lesions must have been completed at least 2 weeks prior to treatment. Subjects with symptomatic tumor lesions that may require palliative radiotherapy within 4 weeks of first treatment are strongly encouraged to receive palliative radiotherapy prior to treatment. Patients are eligible if CNS metastases are adequately treated and patients are neurologically returned to baseline (except for residual signs or symptoms related to the CNS treatment) for at least 2 weeks prior to randomization;

criterions.exact_snippets: Prior palliative radiotherapy to non-CNS lesions must have been completed at least 2 weeks prior to treatment.
criterions.criterion: prior palliative radiotherapy to non-CNS lesions

criterions.exact_snippets: Subjects with symptomatic tumor lesions that may require palliative radiotherapy within 4 weeks of first treatment are strongly encouraged to receive palliative radiotherapy prior to treatment.

requirements.expected_value: strongly encouraged if within 4 weeks of first treatment

criterions.exact_snippets: Patients are eligible if CNS metastases are adequately treated and patients are neurologically returned to baseline (except for residual signs or symptoms related to the CNS treatment) for at least 2 weeks prior to randomization;

requirements.requirement_type: time since neurological return to baseline

inclusion_lines.line: 13. Patients must be either off corticosteroids, or on a stable or decreasing dose of ≤10 mg daily prednisone (or equivalent) for at least 2 weeks prior to randomization.

criterions.exact_snippets: Patients must be either off corticosteroids
on a stable or decreasing dose of ≤10 mg daily prednisone (or equivalent)
for at least 2 weeks prior to randomization
Healthy volunteers allowed

inclusion_lines.line: Must have minimum age of 18 Years

criterions.exact_snippets: minimum age of 18 Years

exclusion_lines.line: 1. Patient positive for actionable EGFR mutations or ALK or ROS1 rearrangement;

criterions.exact_snippets: Patient positive for actionable EGFR mutations
Patient positive for ... ALK ... rearrangement
Patient positive for ... ROS1 rearrangement

exclusion_lines.line: 2. No previous chemoimmunotherapy for metastatic disease or evidence of disease progression during the first 4 cycles of chemoimmunotherapy (primary resistance). Patients with adjuvant resistance (documented loco-regionally and/or systemic relapse of their disease occurring <6 months after the last dose of anti-PD-(L)1-based systemic adjuvant therapy) are excluded;

criterions.exact_snippets: No previous chemoimmunotherapy for metastatic disease
evidence of disease progression during the first 4 cycles of chemoimmunotherapy (primary resistance)
criterions.criterion: disease progression during the first 4 cycles of chemoimmunotherapy

criterions.exact_snippets: Patients with adjuvant resistance (documented loco-regionally and/or systemic relapse of their disease occurring <6 months after the last dose of anti-PD-(L)1-based systemic adjuvant therapy) are excluded

exclusion_lines.line: 3. Patients with intervening systemic therapy following prior anti-PD-(L)1-based therapy;

criterions.exact_snippets: intervening systemic therapy following prior anti-PD-(L)1-based therapy

exclusion_lines.line: 4. Symptomatic brain metastases. Asymptomatic brain metastases are allowed if not requiring corticosteroids use at a dose >10mg daily prednisone (or equivalent);

criterions.exact_snippets: Symptomatic brain metastases.
Asymptomatic brain metastases ... not requiring corticosteroids use at a dose >10mg daily prednisone (or equivalent)

exclusion_lines.line: 5. Diagnosis of any other malignancy during the last 3 years, except for in situ carcinoma of cervix uteri and cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma or other local tumors considered cured;

criterions.exact_snippets: Diagnosis of any other malignancy during the last 3 years
except for in situ carcinoma of cervix uteri
criterions.criterion: in situ carcinoma of cervix uteri

criterions.exact_snippets: except for ... cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma
except for ... other local tumors considered cured
Pregnancy
lactating

exclusion_lines.line: 7. Patients with an active, known or suspected autoimmune disease. Patients with type I diabetes mellitus; hypothyroidism only requiring hormone replacement, skin disorders (such as vitiligo, psoriasis, or alopecia) requiring systemic treatment, or conditions not expected to recur in the absence of an external trigger are permitted to enroll;

criterions.exact_snippets: Patients with an active, known or suspected autoimmune disease.
Patients with type I diabetes mellitus;
hypothyroidism only requiring hormone replacement
skin disorders (such as vitiligo, psoriasis, or alopecia) requiring systemic treatment
conditions not expected to recur in the absence of an external trigger

exclusion_lines.line: 8. Patients with a condition requiring systemic treatment with either corticosteroids (> 10 mg daily prednisone equivalent) or other immunosuppressive medications within 14 days of randomization. Inhaled or topical steroids, and adrenal replacement steroid > 10 mg daily prednisone equivalent, are permitted in the absence of active autoimmune disease;

criterions.exact_snippets: condition requiring systemic treatment with either corticosteroids (> 10 mg daily prednisone equivalent) or other immunosuppressive medications within 14 days of randomization
criterions.criterion: systemic treatment with corticosteroids or immunosuppressive medications

criterions.exact_snippets: Inhaled or topical steroids, and adrenal replacement steroid > 10 mg daily prednisone equivalent, are permitted in the absence of active autoimmune disease
criterions.criterion: use of inhaled or topical steroids, and adrenal replacement steroid

exclusion_lines.line: 9. Patients should be excluded if they are positive test for hepatitis B virus surface antigen (HBV sAg) or hepatitis C virus ribonucleic acid (HCV RNA) indicating acute or chronic infection;

criterions.exact_snippets: positive test for hepatitis B virus surface antigen (HBV sAg)
criterions.criterion: hepatitis B virus surface antigen (HBV sAg)

criterions.exact_snippets: positive test for ... hepatitis C virus ribonucleic acid (HCV RNA)
criterions.criterion: hepatitis C virus ribonucleic acid (HCV RNA)

exclusion_lines.line: 10. Patients should be excluded if they have known history of testing positive for human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) or known acquired immunodeficiency syndrome (AIDS).

criterions.exact_snippets: known history of testing positive for human immunodeficiency virus (HIV)
known acquired immunodeficiency syndrome (AIDS)

failed_inclusion.line: 4. Patients must have experienced progressive disease (PD), either during or within 3 months of discontinuing treatment with anti-PD-(L)1-based therapy, occurring after previous clear benefit (any complete -CR- or partial response -PR), or after previous stable disease (SD);

criterions.exact_snippets: Patients must have experienced progressive disease (PD)
either during or within 3 months of discontinuing treatment with anti-PD-(L)1-based therapy

requirements.expected_value: during or within 3 months of discontinuing anti-PD-(L)1-based therapy

criterions.exact_snippets: occurring after previous clear benefit (any complete -CR- or partial response -PR-)
or after previous stable disease (SD)
